The API version number.

uptimeSeconds.description: The number of seconds since the server started.

confirmed.description: Number of DIDs that have been confirmed.

unconfirmed.description: Number of DIDs that remain unconfirmed.

ephemeral.description: Number of DIDs with an expiration (validUntil) set.

invalid.description: Number of DIDs that could not be resolved or are invalid.

byRegistry.description: Count of DIDs grouped by registry.

byVersion.description: Count of DIDs grouped by version.

memoryUsage.description: Memory usage statistics provided by Node.

rss.description: Resident Set Size – total memory allocated for the process.

heapTotal.description: Total size of the allocated heap.

arrayBuffers.description: Memory allocated for ArrayBuffers and SharedArrayBuffers.

post.summary: Create, update, or delete a DID

type.description: Must be "create" to create a new DID.

created.description: Timestamp of when the operation was created.

registry.description: Registry where the DID is created.

validUntil.description: Optional expiration time for ephemeral DIDs.

signature.description: Cryptographic signature verifying the create operation.

signer.description: The DID of the signer (for asset creation, should match `controller`).

hash.description: Hash of the operation payload, if applicable.

publicJwk.description: Required if mdip.type = "agent". Contains the public key in JWK format.

controller.description: Required if mdip.type = "asset". Must match the `signer` in `signature`.

type.description: Must be "update" to modify an existing DID document.

doc.description: The updated DID document or subset of data.

previd.description: Reference to the previous version CID/hash.

signature.description: Cryptographic signature verifying this update operation.

signer.description: The DID of the signer (often the same as `did`).

hash.description: Optional hash of the operation payload.

type.description: Must be "delete" to deactivate an existing DID.

signature.description: Cryptographic signature verifying this delete operation.

signer.description: The DID of the signer, who must have authority to delete.

hash.description: Optional hash of the operation payload.

200.description: - If `type = "create"`, returns the newly created DID as a string. - Otherwise (for update or delete), returns a boolean value indicating success.

oneOf.description: A DID string (when a create operation succeeds).
A success indicator for update/delete operations.

parameters.name: atTime
parameters.description: Timestamp to return the state of the DID as of this specific time.

parameters.name: atVersion
parameters.description: Specific version of the DID Document to retrieve. Versioning increments each time an `update` or `delete` operation occurs.

parameters.name: confirm
parameters.description: If `true`, returns the DID Document if it is fully confirmed.

parameters.name: verify
parameters.description: If `true`, verifies the signature(s) of the DID operation(s) before returning the DID Document. If a signature is invalid, an error is thrown.

200.description: Successfully resolved DID Document.

schema.description: The fully-resolved DID Document along with metadata describing its state.

controller.description: The DID or entity controlling this key.

publicKeyJwk.description: Public key data in JWK format.

authentication.description: Refers to the verification methods used for authentication.

didDocumentMetadata.description: Metadata associated with the DID Document.

created.description: Timestamp indicating when the DID was created.

updated.description: Timestamp indicating the last update to the DID, if any.

deleted.description: Timestamp of when the DID was deleted (if it was deleted).

version.description: Current version number of the DID Document.

versionId.description: CID (or similar) identifying the current version’s content.

canonicalId.description: The canonical DID if a custom prefix was used.

confirmed.description: Indicates whether the DID is fully confirmed.

deactivated.description: Indicates if the DID is deactivated (via a delete operation).

didDocumentData.description: Arbitrary data attached to the DID (for assets).

registry.description: Registry in which this DID is maintained.

validUntil.description: Optional expiration timestamp for ephemeral DIDs.

registration.description: Blockchain or other registry reference for an updated or deleted DID.

404.description: DID not found. The DID either does not exist or cannot be resolved.

did.description: The DID being updated. Must match the path parameter `{did}`.

doc.description: The updated DID Document or subset of data for this DID.

200.description: A boolean indicating if the update was accepted.

type.description: Must be "delete" to deactivate the DID.

200.description: A boolean indicating whether the deletion was accepted and processed.

post.summary: Retrieve a list of DIDs or DID Documents.

dids.description: A list of specific DIDs to check. If omitted, all known DIDs are retrieved.

updatedAfter.description: Only return DIDs/DID Docs updated *after* this time.

updatedBefore.description: Only return DIDs/DID Docs updated *before* this time.

confirm.description: If true, only return DID Docs that are fully confirmed.

verify.description: If true, verifies signatures during DID resolution. If signature checks fail, an error is thrown.

resolve.description: If true, return DID Documents instead of just string identifiers.

200.description: An array of DIDs or DID Documents.

oneOf.description: An array of DID Document objects (if `resolve` is true).

200.description: Indicates whether the operation succeeded.

post.summary: Export events for one or more DIDs

dids.description: A list of DIDs to export. If omitted, all known DIDs are exported.

200.description: Returns an array of arrays, where each sub-array contains the event objects for a single DID.

schema.description: Each element corresponds to a DID's event list.

items.description: An array of event objects for a single DID.
A single event in the DID's event history.

time.description: Timestamp indicating when this event occurred.

oneOf.description: A single integer ordinal (often 0 if unused)
A tuple of integers for multi-part ordinal keys

operation.description: The DID operation that defines changes.

did.description: The DID this event belongs to.

schema.description: An array where each item is itself an array of event objects corresponding to a single DID’s history.

items.description: A list of all events that define one DID's state.

did.description: The DID these events belong to.

operation.description: The DID operation including signatures and other data.

publicJwk.description: Public key in JWK format (required for agent creates).

registry.description: The registry this event belongs to.

time.description: Timestamp when this event was recorded.

oneOf.description: A single integer ordinal (often 0 if unused)
A tuple of integers for multi-part ordinal keys

200.description: Summary of the import operation.

schema.description: Object containing counts of how many events were queued, processed (duplicates), rejected, and the current queue total.

processed.description: Number of events recognized as duplicates (already known).

rejected.description: Number of events that failed validation (bad signature, size limit, etc.).

total.description: Total number of events in the queue after this import.

post.summary: Export non-local DID events in a single sorted batch

dids.description: A list of DIDs to export. If omitted, all known DIDs are used for exporting.

200.description: A single sorted array of all non-local events for the specified DIDs.

schema.description: Each item is an event object, sorted by the signature’s signed timestamp.

registry.description: Registry for this event. Local registry events are excluded.

time.description: When this event was recorded in the database.

oneOf.description: A single integer ordinal (often 0 if unused)
A tuple of integers for multi-part ordinal keys

did.description: The DID for which this event applies.
The DID this event belongs to, generally matching operation.did.

post.summary: Import a batch of DID events

schema.description: An array of event objects representing DID operations.

did.description: The DID to which this event pertains.

operation.description: A DID operation, such as "create", "update", or "delete".

created.description: Timestamp when the DID was created (if `type = "create"`).

publicJwk.description: Public key in JWK format, required for "agent" creation.

registry.description: The registry to which this event belongs.

time.description: Timestamp when the event was recorded.

oneOf.description: A single integer ordinal (often 0 if unused)
A tuple of integers for multi-part ordinal keys

200.description: An object summarizing how many events were queued, processed, rejected, and the current queue size.

queued.description: Number of new, valid events that were queued.

processed.description: Number of events recognized as duplicates.

rejected.description: Number of events that failed validation.

total.description: The total event queue size after this import.

get.summary: Retrieve the queued events for a specific registry

parameters.name: registry
parameters.description: The name of the registry whose queue is being retrieved. Valid values may include "local", "hyperswarm", "TBTC", "TFTC", etc.

200.description: An array of queued event objects for the specified registry.

items.description: An individual event in the queue.

registry.description: The registry to which the event belongs.

time.description: Timestamp when this event was added to the queue.

oneOf.description: A single integer ordinal (often 0 if unused)
A tuple of integers for multi-part ordinal keys

did.description: The DID to which this event applies.
The DID that this queue event references (often identical to `operation.did`).

post.summary: Remove specified DIDs from the queue

parameters.name: registry
parameters.description: The name of the registry from which events will be cleared. Must be a valid, supported registry.

schema.description: An array of DID operation event objects to remove from the queue.

did.description: The DID targeted by this operation.

doc.description: The (optional) DID document content, present if type is "update" or "create" with doc data.

200.description: The updated queue after clearing the specified events.

schema.description: An array of remaining events in the queue. Could be empty if all events were cleared.

200.description: An array of registry names.
The database was successfully reset.

get.summary: Verify all DIDs in the database

200.description: Verification results for all DIDs in the database.

total.description: The total number of DIDs that were checked.

verified.description: The count of DIDs that passed verification.

expired.description: The count of DIDs that had expired and were removed.

invalid.description: The count of DIDs that failed verification and were removed.

post.description: Iterates over all queued events, importing them if they are valid (adding or merging). Continues until no more new events can be processed. If `processEvents` is already running, it may return `{ busy: true }` to indicate that processing is in progress.

200.description: A summary of how many events were added, merged, rejected, or still pending in the queue. Or `{ busy: true }` if processing is already underway.

busy.description: Indicates that the processing is already in progress.

rejected.description: Number of events that failed validation.

pending.description: Number of events still left in the queue after processing.
